greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Suppose n=(p1^e1)(p2^e2)... where p1,p2,... are the prime numbers and e1,e2,... are nonnegative integers. Then we can define Pn(x) = e1 + (e2)*x + (e3)*(x^2) + (e4)*(x^3) + ... + (ek)*(x^(k-1)) + ... The sequence is the table T(n,x)=Pn(x) read by descending antidiagonals.
comment: The square array A(row,col) is read by downwards antidiagonals as: A(1,1), A(1,2), A(2,1), A(1,3), A(2,2), A(3,1), etc.

A(n,m) (entry at row=n, column=m) gives the evaluation at x=n of the polynomial (with nonnegative integer coefficients) bijectively encoded in the prime factorization of m. See A206284, A206296 for the details of that encoding. (The roles of variables n and m were accidentally swapped in this description, corrected by _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 30 2016)
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5050; the first 100 antidiagonals of the array
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: A(n,A206296(k)) = A073133(n,k). [This formula demonstrates how this array can be used with appropriately encoded polynomials. Note that A073133 reads its antidiagonals by ascending order, while here the order is opposite.] - _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 30 2016
The sequence is defined by the following identities:
T(n, m*k) = T(n, m) + T(n, k);
example: The top left corner of the array:
program: (MIT/GNU Scheme, with Aubrey Jaffer's SLIB Scheme library)
(define (A104244bi row col) (fold-left (lambda (sum p.e) (+ sum (* (cdr p.e) (expt row (- (A000720 (car p.e)) 1))))) 0 (if (= 1 col) (list) (elemcountpairs (sort (factor col) <)))))

(define (elemcountpairs lista) (let loop ((pairs (list)) (lista lista) (prev #f)) (cond ((not (pair? lista)) (reverse! pairs)) ((equal? (car lista) prev) (set-cdr! (car pairs) (+ 1 (cdar pairs))) (loop pairs (cdr lista) prev)) (else (loop (cons (cons (car lista) 1) pairs) (cdr lista) (car lista))))))
xref: A297845 represents multiplication of the relevant polynomials.
results.author: _Olaf Voß_, Feb 26 2005
ext: Starting offset changed from 0 to 1 by _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 29 2015
